> We need a way of removing the build and installation of the example projects from the build and installation of all 

I suspect this is causing another problem for me. I usually install to the default destination directory using sudo, like:

~~~
cmake ..
make -j8
sudo make install
~~~

But then if I try to call `make` again without `sudo`, I get an error:

~~~
CPack Error: Problem removing toplevel directory: /mnt/TERA/code/ign-cmake/build/examples/prerelease_Release-prefix/src/prerelease_Release-build/_CPack_Packages/Linux-Source/TBZ2
CPack Error: Error when generating package: ignition-minimal
Makefile:118: recipe for target 'package_source' failed
~~~

I imagine this happens because that file inside the `build` directory is created when I run `sudo make install`. Is it common practice to allow `install` to create files in the build directory?
